file_content.text: You have done well, slave. The last Rakata thank you.
We have delivered upgrades for your droids to your ship, so that you do not assume that we are in your debt.
We cannot help you unless you give your information to the mother machine.
I am Warden Gorshaa. We are the last of the true masters, the Rakata. We watch over this place, guarding it from intruding slaves.
I hear you have a device that could heal me.
Can you help me?
Perhaps you haven't noticed, but your prisoners are escaping.
You've done a terrible job.
They are not what we guard. Nor do we care about the other slaves that meddle here. They have no imagination.
But you found our machines and wondered "why" and that question led you to us. Nothing on this planet escapes our notice.
I don't care about your secrets. I want to be healed.
Why attack me?
Ah yes, you took power for yourself that you could not wield. Nothing on this planet escapes our notice.
We cannot heal you, but we can rebuild you. First, though, you will do something for us.
What do you mean, rebuild me?
Rebuild?
As the Rakata lost our connection to the Force, we have performed many experiments on many species, including your own.
Nothing's free, is it?
That figures.
It is only fitting. Even as we lost our connection to the Force, the machines we made put your species' greatest monuments to shame.
What can a slave like me do for such perfect beings?
I thought I was below you.
Long ago, we Rakata began to lose our connection to the Force. We formed this place as a place of research.
We planned to study the lesser species and see which could be modified for Force sensitivity. We would use that knowledge to save ourselves.
That is the reason we built the machine. It can rebuild you, but you must allow it to take an imprint of your pattern, so we may continue our research.
What horrible fate awaits me if I say "no"?
And if I refuse?
Collection of your pattern is part of the process. The machine cannot rebuild you without it. It is impossible to refuse.
Fine.
Gladly.
It is simple. Use this datakey to access the heart of the prison and access the machine.
It is programmed to follow the instructions on the key. It will take your pattern and then rebuild you.
You have performed most acceptably. You might have turned away, you might have been killed. But here you are.
Perhaps there is hope for the slave races after all.
You'll find I'm far from powerless. Besides, condescension is unbecoming.
Watch who you call a slave.
You will not profit by denying your station.
I take it you're the one who gave the cryptic warning in the lab.
You again.
Did you just try to kill me?
What were those droids?
We had to be sure you were worthy. The other one held such promise, but he did not make it.
